In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a function in Julia that wraps a string to a specified text width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    lines = String[]

    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        if isempty(line)
            line = word
        else
            line = line * " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, line)
    
    return join(lines, "\n") 
end
```

Here is an example usage and output:

```julia
text = "This is a test string that will be wrapped"

print(wrap_string(text))
```

```
This is a 
test string 
that will be 
wrapped
```

The key aspects:

- Split text into words 
- Build up each line, checking if adding the next word would exceed the text width
- Push the line to the lines array when it hits the limit
- Join the lines with newlines when done
